examples: Mediating between living and nonliving things are nutrients like carbon, nitrogen, and oxygen, which cycle in and out of organisms in different ways.
And scientists think that spontaneous decidualization could have evolved to mediate this relationship.
The media, as the name suggests, mediates this information and shapes it in powerful ways.
This means she conducts religious rites, but she also serves as a judge, healer, and scholar, teaching children and mediating conflict between Celtic tribes.
What was more interesting is that the CNS survey results seemed to mediate the effects of the environment.
words.defineEn: to help end a dispute between people by trying to find something on which everyone agrees
words.defineVi: giúp chấm dứt tranh chấp giữa mọi người bằng cách cố gắng tìm ra điều gì đó mà mọi người đều đồng ý

examples: Fast forward to 2013, when a federal judge ordered the two sides in the case into mediation.
If you travel a lot or you just have a very busy life, these mediations can create a tether to your pharmacy which can feel very confining.
This as the fighting between Hamas and Israeli forces continued despite mediation attempts by Egyptian security officials.
This as the fighting between Hamas and Israeli forces continued despite mediation attempts by Egyptian security officials.
And beyond this Audible is also giving members even more with their new Plus Catalog, which has thousands of select audiobooks, podcasts, guided fitness and mediation programs, and more!
words.defineEn: the process or act of helping those involved in a conflict reach an agreement
words.defineVi: quá trình hoặc hành động giúp đỡ những người tham gia vào một cuộc xung đột đạt được một thỏa thuận

examples: When the neighbors argued over their property lines, the mediator advised them to let every fox take care of his own tail and not to interfere with each other's property.
The mediator reminded the disputing parties that it takes two to make a bargain, and encouraged them to listen to each other's needs and work together to find a solution that satisfied both parties.
Egyptian mediators say there's a truce agreement in principle.
He said that he wouldn't mind being a mediator.
So if the i d is the devil on your shoulder, the superego is the angel on the other shoulder, and the ego is the mediator who intervenes when the angel and devil start fighting.
words.defineEn: an organization or person who tries to help those in a conflict reach an agreement
words.defineVi: một tổ chức hoặc người cố gắng giúp những người trong cuộc xung đột đạt được thỏa thuận

examples: CHRIS WALLACE, Moderator: You have repeatedly criticized the vice president.
Scroll down to "AUTO-MODERATOR."
We're going to make a moderator bot.
In our light water reactor, a moderator is needed to control the neutrons’ energy.
I'll be talking to the moderator about it.
words.defineEn: someone who, as a job, helps opposing sides come to an agreement
words.defineVi: một người, như một công việc, giúp các bên đối nghịch đi đến một thỏa thuận

words.defineEn: to persuade someone to do what one wants by threatening them or giving them money
words.defineVi: để thuyết phục một ai đó để làm những gì một người muốn bằng cách đe dọa họ hoặc cho họ tiền

examples: Her kind, patient demeanor earned her the nickname the Peacekeeper.
In my opinion, it's bad that the Russian peacekeepers arrived.
In my opinion, it's bad that the Russian peacekeepers arrived.
If Turkey came, yes, but I don't approve of Russian peacekeepers.
If Turkey came, yes, but I don't approve of Russian peacekeepers.
words.defineEn: someone who tries to stop others from fighting or quarreling
words.defineVi: một người cố gắng ngăn người khác đánh nhau hoặc cãi nhau

examples: Unlike the other Celtic tribes, Roman legions have no regard for the druids’ sacred role as peacemakers.
Forty-eight-year-old Abraham Martin Vega of Texas will be remembered as a peacemaker, his daughter Cori said.
New Yorkers hoped Dinkins would be the peacemaker.
And, certainly, Nancy Reagan believed that this should be her husband's place in history, as a peacemaker and not a warmonger.
The riots seemed to epitomize Dinkins’ failings not only as a leader, but also as a peacemaker.
words.defineEn: a country or person who tries to persuade other countries or people to stop quarreling or fighting
words.defineVi: một quốc gia hoặc người cố gắng thuyết phục các quốc gia hoặc người dân khác ngừng cãi vã hoặc chiến đấu

examples: The overwhelming majority of Irish-Americans probably persuaded the administration that the cake was not worth the candle.
The salesman was a fast talker who persuaded the old lady to buy a new washing machine.
I tried to persuade the Chancellor not to go.
George didn't want to come, but we persuaded him to change his mind.
Bob persuaded her to go by car, against her better judgement, and she regretted it as soon as she saw the heavy traffic.
words.defineEn: to make a person do something by giving them a good reason why they should do it
words.defineVi: để làm cho một người làm điều gì đó bằng cách cho họ một lý do chính đáng tại sao họ nên làm điều đó

examples: He's a tough customer, but with some persuasion, we were able to close the deal.
In relationships and negotiations, it's important to remember that persuasion is better than force.
We ran very, very little money for persuasion.
We ran an extremely minuscule amount of money into persuasion.
There's no persuasion.
words.defineEn: the process or act of persuading someone to do or believe something particular
words.defineVi: quá trình hoặc hành động thuyết phục ai đó làm hoặc tin vào điều gì đó cụ thể

examples: She is so persuasive that she has people eating out of her hand in no time.
The essay was written in persuasive form, with the author arguing for a particular point of view.
The negotiator held all the aces with their persuasive arguments, information, and bargaining power, and got a favorable deal.
Lily was known for her strong will and persuasive abilities, which often resulted in her getting her way during important decision-making processes.
Statistics are persuasive.
words.defineEn: capable of convincing others to do or believe something particular
words.defineVi: có khả năng thuyết phục người khác làm hoặc tin vào điều gì đó cụ thể

examples: She pressed her cheek against the cool glass window.
I pressed the issue home to them.
The tabloid press ran the story.
The press as always gave him a free pass as with so many other issues.
The winter issue is hot off the press.
words.defineEn: to try very hard to persuade someone to do something
words.defineVi: cố gắng hết sức để thuyết phục ai đó làm gì

examples: The nurse takes my blood pressure.
They all feel pressure from managers to make a sale.
The pressure began to tell as rain closed in after 20 laps.
The team captain felt the pressure of leading his team to victory, knowing that the outcome would reflect on his leadership.
In the novel, the protagonist is pressured by her parents to marry money and is introduced to a wealthy suitor who can provide her with a luxurious lifestyle.
words.defineEn: to force or persuade someone to do something
words.defineVi: để buộc hoặc thuyết phục một ai đó để làm một cái gì đó

examples: The nurse takes my blood pressure.
They all feel pressure from managers to make a sale.
The pressure began to tell as rain closed in after 20 laps.
The team captain felt the pressure of leading his team to victory, knowing that the outcome would reflect on his leadership.
In the novel, the protagonist is pressured by her parents to marry money and is introduced to a wealthy suitor who can provide her with a luxurious lifestyle.
words.defineEn: the action of forcing, persuading, or intimidating someone into doing something
words.defineVi: hành động ép buộc, thuyết phục hoặc đe dọa ai đó làm điều gì đó

examples: - Pressurize the hose.
- Pressurize the hose.
Tank is pressurizing.
Eventually, the pens were pressurized with nitrogen gas.
We're going to pressurize this thing.
words.defineEn: to force someone to do something
words.defineVi: để buộc một ai đó để làm một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to persuade and convince a person to do something
words.defineVi: để thuyết phục và thuyết phục một người làm điều gì đó

examples: She pushed the stroller along the path in the park.
They pushed the heavy box across the room.
The weight of the world pushed him to his knees.
She pushed the cart down the aisle at the grocery store.
The new product design pushes the limits of what is currently available on the market.
words.defineEn: to influence someone to do something, particularly something that might be against their will
words.defineVi: gây ảnh hưởng đến ai đó làm điều gì đó, đặc biệt là điều gì đó có thể trái với ý muốn của họ

examples: My brother doesn't move an inch once he gets an idea in his head, so don't bother trying to reason with him.

I'm going to try to reason with him first
Barack Obama came into office thinking, well, I can reason with them.
It’s much easier to set up failsafes now than to try to reason with a computer that’s smarter than us.
words.defineEn: to talk to someone to convince them to act or think more rationally
words.defineVi: nói chuyện với ai đó để thuyết phục họ hành động hoặc suy nghĩ hợp lý hơn

examples: A sinfully attractive man who knows what he wants, Rafael seduces Cherri before she knows what hits her.

You're seducing me in another man's lingerie?

You were probably trying to seduce Sarah, that's my guess.
words.defineEn: to influence someone to do something by making it seem interesting or pleasant
words.defineVi: ảnh hưởng đến ai đó để làm điều gì đó bằng cách làm cho nó có vẻ thú vị hoặc dễ chịu

words.defineEn: the ability of persuading others to believe something or do something that one wants
words.defineVi: khả năng thuyết phục người khác tin vào điều gì đó hoặc làm điều gì đó mà người ta muốn

words.defineEn: skilled at persuading others to believe something or do what one wants
words.defineVi: có kỹ năng thuyết phục người khác tin vào điều gì đó hoặc làm những gì người ta muốn

words.defineEn: talking with confidence and politeness in order to persuade someone to do something, in a manner that might be insincere or dishonest
words.defineVi: nói chuyện với sự tự tin và lịch sự để thuyết phục ai đó làm điều gì đó, theo cách có thể không thành thật hoặc không trung thực

words.defineEn: to be very nice to someone so that the chance of them agreeing to do what one wants is increased
words.defineVi: rất tốt với ai đó để cơ hội họ đồng ý làm những gì một người muốn được tăng lên

examples: Don't be swayed by false promises or quick fixes.

words.defineEn: to encourage someone to do or believe something
words.defineVi: để khuyến khích một ai đó để làm hoặc tin tưởng một cái gì đó

examples: A teaspoon of sugar can sweeten your morning coffee or tea.

They mixed sugar syrup into their lemonade, creating a refreshing and sweetened summer drink.
And I'm going to sweeten the deal.
words.defineEn: to attempt to persuade someone to do what one wants by promising them something or giving something to them
words.defineVi: cố gắng thuyết phục ai đó làm những gì họ muốn bằng cách hứa với họ điều gì đó hoặc đưa cho họ thứ gì đó

examples: Going to talk into it here.

words.defineEn: to convince someone to do something they do not want to do
words.defineVi: để thuyết phục ai đó làm điều gì đó mà họ không muốn làm

words.defineEn: to advise someone against doing something
words.defineVi: để khuyên ai đó chống lại làm điều gì đó

examples: People were tempted into the trade by the thought of easy money.
It's true what they say - an open door may tempt a saint.
One of my colleagues was rude to me in a meeting, and I was tempted to snap back.
Sadly, new customers are being enticed by tempting promotions only to find the dice are loaded against them.

words.defineEn: to persuade someone to do something that seems interesting to them, even though they know it is not good for them
words.defineVi: thuyết phục ai đó làm điều gì đó có vẻ thú vị với họ, mặc dù họ biết điều đó không tốt cho họ

words.phonetic: tə twɪst wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs ɑːɹm
words.defineEn: to force or persuade someone to do something they are unwilling to do
words.defineVi: buộc hoặc thuyết phục ai đó làm điều gì đó mà họ không muốn làm

examples: Officials are urging residents not to try to weather the storm.
Experts have urged ministers to take the necessary steps to resolve the issue.
She urged him to reach out to his family.
Management urged cabin crew to call off their work to rule.
The strong wind urged on the sails of the boat, helping it move faster.
words.defineEn: to try hard to persuade or encourage someone to do something
words.defineVi: cố gắng hết sức để thuyết phục hoặc khuyến khích ai đó làm điều gì đó

words.defineEn: to try to change someone's opinion about something and gain their support or favor
words.defineVi: cố gắng thay đổi quan điểm của ai đó về điều gì đó và giành được sự ủng hộ hoặc ủng hộ của họ

words.defineEn: to try to change someone's opinion on something and gain their favor or support
words.defineVi: cố gắng thay đổi quan điểm của ai đó về điều gì đó và giành được sự ủng hộ hoặc ủng hộ của họ

words.defineEn: to attempt to persuade someone to do or agree to something
words.defineVi: để cố gắng thuyết phục ai đó làm hoặc đồng ý với một cái gì đó
